Arrangement
Materials are arranged in alphabetical order by topic.
Processing Information
No original order was apparent on receipt of the materials from the donor. The materials were grouped by topic and placed in archival folders and boxes.
Scope and Contents
This collection contains newspaper clippings, photographs, minutes from the negotiating committee, copies of contracts, and leaflets.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by John A. Lovari in 2000. The accession number 2000.029 is associated with this gift.
Conditions Governing Use
Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by John Lovari was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Historical/Biographical Note
In 1979 the staff of the New-York Historical Society began an organizing drive with District 65, United Automobile Workers of America. Victory in the union elections led to contract negotiations later in the same year. The negotiations were unsuccessful, and the staff conducted a six month strike before signing a collective bargaining agreement in 1980.
John Lovari was a reference librarian at the New-York Historical Society, head of the negotiating committee, and after an agreement was reached, a shop steward.
